Settings.AutoRemoveTargetsHint: When enabled, automatically clears current targets when using the weapon HUD, requiring selection of a new target.
Settings.ShowWeaponMenuOnSelection: Show Weapon Menu on Token Selection
Settings.ShowWeaponMenuOnSelectionHint: Automatically show the weapon menu when selecting a token you own.
Settings.ReopenMenuAfterDragHint: When enabled, the weapon menu will automatically reopen after you finish dragging a token.
Settings.WeaponItemsPerRowHint: The number of items to display per row in the weapon menu.
Settings.WeaponIconScaleHint: Scale factor for weapon menu icons relative to grid size (0.3 = 30% of grid square, 1.0 = 100% of grid square).
Settings.DetailedWeaponTooltipsHint: Show detailed weapon information (damage, range, AP, trait modifier) in tooltips. When disabled, only shows weapon name and ammo count.
Settings.DebugModeHint: Enable debug logging for troubleshooting weapon menu issues
Settings.ShowEquipmentBadgesHint: Display status badges on items in equipment mode (equipment status for weapons, favorite status for powers).
Settings.EquipmentBadgeColorHint: Color for the equipment status and power favorite badges. Click to open color picker.
Settings.EquipmentBadgeBgColorHint: Background color for the equipment status and power favorite badges. Click to open color picker.
Settings.UseEquipmentStateColorsHint: When enabled, badge colors will change based on equipment state (green for active/equipped, yellow for carried, default for stored).
Settings.EquipmentColorActiveHint: Color for active items (equipped weapons, carried templates, favorited powers). Click to open color picker.
Settings.EquipmentColorCarriedHint: Color for carried but not equipped weapons. Click to open color picker.
Settings.EquipmentModeZoomHint: Automatically zoom in on the token when entering equipment mode.
Settings.EquipmentModeZoomLevelHint: Zoom level when entering equipment mode (1.0 = 100%, 2.0 = 200%).
Settings.EquipmentModeZoomDurationHint: Animation duration in milliseconds (0 = instant, 1000 = 1 second).
